fundingSource.grantName: RII Track-1: Anticipating the Climate-Water Transition and Cascading Challenges to Socio-Environmental Systems in America's Headwaters

researchObjective.description: Wyoming SEaSON established by WyACT (2022-2027) will focus on the anticipated climate-driven changes to precipitation and snowpack and their impacts on watershed ecohydrology, terrestrial and aquatic ecosystem dynamics, and socioeconomic responses and feedbacks in the headwaters of the Snake-Columbia, Green-Colorado, and Wind-Bighorn-Missouri River drainages in Wyoming.

Datastreams.description: Water temperature measured at 1 meter depth

unitOfMeasurement.definition: Indicates the concentration of oxygen molecules dissolved in a liter of water.

Datastreams.description: Dissolved oxygen at saturation; calculated from dissolved oxygen measurement

unitOfMeasurement.name: percentage
unitOfMeasurement.definition: expressed as a percentage and represents the saturation level of oxygen in water.

unitOfMeasurement.definition: A millibar is 1/1000th of a bar and is the amount of force it takes to move an object weighing a gram, one centimeter, in one second

name: SSN00011
description: Zentra Cloud soil sensor nest with met station

Locations.name: Jackson Hole Mountain Resort 1
Locations.description: The Jackson Hole Mountain Resort snowtography site is located on a flat bench at 2926m, directly below SSE-facing Rendezvous Bowl and above S-facing aspects of Rock Springs Bowl, just outside of the resort’s western boundary. Mixed conifers dominated by Engelmann spruce and subalpine fir and including whitebark pine both living and dead present as a ribbon forest on the bench with 15-30m wide N-S trending lanes of tree cover separated by similar width clearings. The snowtography transect runs perpendicular to the ribbon structure, around 50m north of the southern perimeter of the bench. The installation is 45m in length with 5m sampling across a single forest ribbon/clearing pair. Two soil moisture pits located mid-ribbon, and mid-clearing, monitor moisture characteristics and temperature at 10cm and 20cm depths in soil above loose limestone. A weather station located in a clearing at a height of 490cm monitors solar radiation, air temperature, atmospheric and vapor pressure, steady and gusting wind speed and direction, precipitation, and lightning counts.

dataPolicy.usageRestrictions: Data must be cited with project reference.
